showerReviews.reviewText:
The staff were really helpful and the ladies changing rooms were clean. The locker we used was in a small "U" shape near the entrance to the changing room. Unfortunately when it came time to leave the pool it made getting things from the lockers harder as it felt quite tight.

Into the pool: the pool itself is a beach style pool with a wave machine as well as a broken - bucket fill activity (not sure how else to describe it - the joystick did nothing and the buckets had to be filled manually). The waterfall mushroom was nice and the small slide although I think a slightly bigger slide would have been appreciated by the kids there. I'm not sure exactly what the giant ball barricade was for, other kids were climbing on it and not getting told off and it did provide a sheltered area from the wave machine. It was a nice touch that an inflatable net and several beach balls as well as soft balls were available but they were quickly taken if you didn't get to them quick enough. There were also water cannons that could be moved and angled but these did not get much attention from the children there.
The humidity and the pool was much cooler than I was expecting and another swimmer commented that the day before when they visited that people were going blue it was that cold. Which is surprising as you would expect warmer waters over a half term when more children are going to be using the facilities. Even I found the water to be a bit chilly on the day so had to keep an eye on those I was with.
From the pool you can see the "cafeteria" if you wish to call it that. When we went swimming over the lunchtime period and from the pool you could see shutters down so it was closed and your options were two vending machines so we didn't bother to explore it after for a warm drink to warm up with.
showerReviews.author: Carys Newing

showerReviews.reviewText:
The facilities at Village Gym are quite good. The equipment is well maintained, and there is a wide range of cardio and weight machines. The gym has two strength and free weights areas, good fitness classes, an excellent spin studio, and a large pool that usually has lanes open. The sauna is small, and the lower benches sometimes get moisture damage, although they do get replaced. The steam room is generally fine, but the area where your back rests can feel a bit slimy. The cool dip pool is great, and thereâ€™s an outdoor gym area, although Iâ€™ve never seen anyone using it.

The showers work, but they could definitely use some attention. Some locks donâ€™t work properly, some shelving is loose or tilted, and thereâ€™s noticeable wear and tear in some cubicles.

The everyday staff are consistently friendly, welcoming, and helpful. Iâ€™ve always had a good experience with them.

Where the gym falls short is in administration and communication regarding policies. When I joined, I was told off-peak access was until 5 pm, but in reality, your pass stops working at 4:30. This means you need to ask staff to let you in manually, which wasnâ€™t explained upfront and can feel awkward. To be fair, the off-peak package is good overall, especially with unrestricted access on weekends, but the weekday cut-off should be clearly explained.

The complimentary guest passes were also disappointing. They come with restrictions that arenâ€™t made clear at the start. Guests receive membership sales calls afterward without having given permission. This makes the passes feel more like a sales tool than a genuine perk.

Overall, itâ€™s a strong gym with solid facilities and excellent staff. However, clearer communication, more transparent policies, and some attention to the changing rooms would significantly improve the member experience.

If you value cleanliness, space, and a well-managed gym, I highly recommend staying away from this place.

Atrocious service at this gym. Multiple times I have had terribly rude and disrespectful staff encounters. They're definitely lacking in the customer service department.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Worst kept service station toilets I've ever been to.

On the way back to Ireland I stopped to take a break & use the toilet facilities before getting some food. Half of the gents was shut off with a barrier. That's fine, it was a quiet time of the day, so why keep it all open (less cleaning). Cleanliness-wise, no issue, it was clean & smelt okay. What was really disappointing was firstly despite the "caution hot water" notices on each sink, not a single hot tap worked. In fact, some were hanging off & one was even taped up (so staff know about the problem). Secondly, not a single soap dispenser had any soap in it. The final thing that then prompted me to write this review was the fact that the only two accessible hand-dryers didn't work either (& there are no paper towels).

All in all, far from the 'Welcome' you'd expect from a Welcome Break. Management at this establishment should be ashamed. All things that should be easily fixable.
showerReviews.author: Shaun Leahy

showerReviews.reviewText: Very rarely stop in services or truck stops. Mostly because of the extortionate pricing. However on this occasion we had a particularly difficult situation and the staff here could really not have been any more helpful, kind and just incredible. They went above and beyond to help me and my colleague out and a fellow family business like the haulier I work for is. Nothing was too much for them. The services provided are good, with clean showers, toilets, water, microwave, and vending machines with a cafe bolted on. I really could not thank them enough for everything they did for me this evening so I hope this review helps show some of that gratitude. Above all the price for 12 hours parking is less than a night out payment. So if you're in the area then come get a good night and also support a family business full of people who have restored some faith in humanity! They are everything that the trucking community should be about. Helping each other out.

The DnB bar bass sound does come through, so if you're a light sleeper/get disturbed by noise, you'll need earplugs (or potentially need to stay elsewhere!)

Keep in mind you *need* to have internet to be able to access the hostel doors, the hostel does have a free WiFi you can use when near to the premises.

On the stay, had someone trying the doors to get in and knock on the dormitory doors (individually locked) at 5 in the morning, but the out of hours number supplied was responded to quickly and someone came up to check what was going on.

Facilities get cleaned daily, basic but serviceable, hot shower and lockable toilets along with a decent common room you can hide in for a bit.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Shocking . Paid 7nights got 8th free  . The facilities signed for but not cleaned as I followed staff in  . The shower block needs demolishing and rebuilding.We used toilet and shower facilities in our unit as they were soo poor on site. Laundry room had not been cleaned first night to last night dog poo bag near washer. Still there on the day we left.Water was tepid to wash dishes 38 deg.
Electric hook up points wrapped in a metal foil . That's an accident waiting to happen. Fridge and freezer provided for use . Absolutely disgusting. Rusty, spilt food , failed door seal.
We were supposed to be there for 8 nights but left 2 nights early.
This place is run by Cardiff City Council. They should be ashamed . Lots of foreign visitors.
Not Cheap. Not a secure site . Plenty of folk passing through.
Sunday was extreemly noisy as castle to castle run took place finishing on Pontcana field adjacent to camp site . Would have been nice to have been informed of expected noise early on a Sunday morning.
On a positive all pitches are serviced . Fantastic location  for city centre venues.  Great walks in beautiful parks . Bike hire available on site. Easy walk to shops pubs cricket ground.
I would like to suggest that whom ever is I charge of this facility at Cardif City Council visits any C&M club site for a comparison.
I plan to phone environmental health regarding some of the issues I found

The boiler failure meant we had to wait in for it to be repaired thus ruining our plans for that day which really isn't acceptable as we were only there for the weekend.
The shower temperature was very hard to control.
For your info dogs aren't allowed in any of the arcades but there are benches outside.

We did enjoy our time though. It is a nice site with great beach access and friendly staff.

showerReviews.reviewText: When my wife asks "Do you want to come to visit the in-laws for a few days" ... All I hear is.. Do you want to come to Swansea Wales to train in The fitness studio. I Love this place.I  travel from Ireland and have trained here many times over the past 17 years. As a Physical Therapist, Fitness enthusiast and Natural Bodybuilder, training is very important to me. Even on holiday. Iv trained in Gyms all over the World and this Gym is up there as one of the best gyms iv ever trained in. Huge.. Huge and Great range of equipment.. Great atmosphere. The staff and members are great, very friendly and welcoming. An abundance of machines and mind blowing variety , free weights and cardio equipment. It's very spacious and non intimidating. No waiting around for a free bench or any other equipment it's that big and well stocked. Incredible studios too. I'd spend hours here. It's like a candy shop for Fitness lovers and anyone just starting their Fitness Journey. My photos aren't misleading.. It's that huge. I made a walk through video from changing rooms to Gyms end and it lasts more than 4 mins. I wish I could upload it to the review. Plenty  of parking as well. This place is more than a Gym. It is a very important fitness hub for the people of the area and surrounding towns. 5 stars. Simply incredible.

locations.address: îƒˆBay Beach, Oxwich, Gower, Swansea SA3 1LS, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
Birthday treat for partner and what a relaxing start to the day! Cooking at 92 degrees whilst overlooking one of the most beautiful beaches in the Gower, then gently cooling down by wandering out to sea. Or you can choose to pour a bucket of cold water over yourself (not for me).
We had opted for a communal session but it wasnâ€™t fully booked so didnâ€™t feel cramped, and I quite enjoyed chatting with other sauna guests and compare notes. Although set aside from the public beach, to get to the sea you will come across many beach goers but that only added to the uniqueness of the experience.
We did 3 rounds within the allotted time slot which was just right for us. Friendly staff member was available for questions and facilitate the experience.
The changing room is small but well thought out and I left my valuables with staff in the adjoining reception/office. We appreciated we could chill out on chairs after the session, and then stoped at the nearby beach cafe/shop for a coffee.
It was a really hot day but I would love to come back when itâ€™s cold, dark and moody as imagine it will give you a great boost.
Couple of tips for newbies - allow plenty of time for parking in high season, we queued for 15 minutes mid morning on a scorching bank holiday and only just made it, when we left the car park a few hours later the cars were tailing back half a mile or more. I also suggest to check the tide when booking as it can be a long walk when fully out. Public facilities near the sauna are very basic and Iâ€™m not sure if they are open in the evening.
showerReviews.author: Sylvia Ossel

locations.title: Crown Place Swansea - Student Accommodation
locations.address: îƒˆCrown Place, 2 Kings Rd, Swansea SA1 8FE, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
My stay at Crown Place was nothing short of incredible, and I can confidently say it significantly elevated my student experience.

Location, Location, Location
The dorm is situated in an ideal location that has the best of both worlds. The convenience of supermarkets and the city center are within arm's reach, making last-minute grocery runs or spontaneous outings incredibly easy. Moreover, it boasts excellent transport links, which were a lifesaver for someone like me who had to dash to various places around the city.

Staff and Maintenance
The staff at Crown Place are genuinely lovely people who make a significant effort to create a welcoming atmosphere. Every issue I've had was promptly addressed, and any fixes were done at lightning speed. The management even gives a heads up before any big changes, which I really appreciated.

Amenities Galore
Where do I even start? The cinema room was a perfect escape after a long day of classes, and the lounge was a cozy space ideal for both studying and socializing. The laundry room was well-maintained, and the gym facilities were fantastic. Although I never visited the gaming or karaoke rooms, the word around the dorm is that they're top-notch.

Room Features
The rooms feel modern, fresh, and impeccably designed. Mine still smelled brand new, and the interior design was on point. The room layout managed to encapsulate the essence of a cozy home while maximizing function. I particularly enjoyed the spacious shower and kitchen areaâ€”everything seemed meticulously planned. Let's not forget the many outlets and reliable wifi, which are student lifesavers.

The View
One of the best features of my room was the breathtaking view overlooking the river and the cityscape. It was especially magical at night. Additionally, if you're someone who values peace and quiet, the riverside rooms offer a serene atmosphere that's conducive for both relaxation and focus.

Final Thoughts
The only regret I have is that I can't live here forever, as I'm no longer a student. If you're looking for an unparalleled student living experience, look no further than Crown Place.

locations.address: îƒˆGlamorgan, 160 St Helen's Rd, Swansea SA1 4DQ, United Kingdom

showerReviews.reviewText:
If I could give this place zero stars I would. Itâ€™s not completely without hope - the location is good - but it is so poorly maintained and frankly filthy that itâ€™s unbearable to spend more than even a few hours in it. Unfortunately, we booked too late so this was our only affordable option, but even then we paid Â£120 for a double room for ONE night. I understand it was high demand as we came for a gig in Swansea, but I canâ€™t imagine anyone paying to stay in this place.

The sheets were both stained and dirty - we found hairs and dead insects on top of the bedding. The floors and rugs were not cleaned - there was a plastic bottle under the bed and dust and dirt all over the floor. The bathrooms - one with a sink and toilet and another with a sink, toilet, and shower - are shared among the five rooms in the flat, which led to obvious issues. If thereâ€™s such high usage, the bathrooms should be cleaned more frequently, and better stocked - by midnight they had run out of toilet paper. The blinds in our room were completely gone, and our room stank to high heaven because it had not been properly aired out. It seems that they come in to change the sheets and thatâ€™s about it, I canâ€™t confidently say anything else was cleaned. I have serious concerns about the level of hygiene in the flats. Funnily enough the kitchen was the cleanest room, probably because nobody used it.

I cannot understand why this place is in business, the people who run it simply do not seem to care. Everything is poorly maintained, and while I have sympathy for the difficulties of running a small business, this place felt like a scam. These people do not care and clearly only provide bare minimum, if that, so do not let them take your money.

showerReviews.reviewText: Situated in quiet countryside right next to Three Cliffs Bay, this is a lovely campsite. The site is very well run and maintained with spotless new facilities. The showers are combined with the toilets in individual cubicles which gives you lots of space. Great for families. Lots of lovely walks either along the coast or inards towards castle ruins, streams or the Gower Inn pub. Standard pitches come with a picnic table and firepit provided. My only minor gripe was that being the end of the season and rather empty, it would be nice if all campers were not placed next to each other. I appreciate this makes it easier to manage, but having neighbours, one a bit noisy, either side whilst 70% of the site was empty, felt a bit strange. You can specify a pitch for extra when booking. Will stay again.

The shop is brilliant with local specialties and great variety of games for kids.
The staff are just brilliant- so friendly and accommodating!

So recently stayed here with our folding camper for 3 nights will honestly say we enjoyed ourselves 2 kids 2 adults been to many places and this will be one we return. After reading some reviews of this place we were a little dubious of how it would be let's just say some of the bad reviews are a little over the top. So let's start with arriving at front gates ok the place is jam packed with caravan of all shapes and size and yes does look a little untidy but and condensed but that's nothing to worry over if you consider price and what u get is fab for a campsite went to reception the people were lovely very helpful and polite so no complaints there all the areas were clean I'd go as far as saying the toilets/shower block were some of the cleanest ice see and that's the men's toilet the dish washing area was lovely with wash machines and tumble dryers. On to the swimming pool yes swimming pool that was fab for the kids they had absolute blast it's indoor pool with a little slide was awesome for the kids although it's not manned by a life guard to me not a real issues as it's free to use. Then you got a nice big park again the kids loved only issue is it's close to main entrance/ way in way out and no real path for kids to use and was rather busy but people drove sensible knowing kids were about. Then you got the club house indoor and outdoor area with patio heaters for when it gets chilly inside was great with bingo and live entertainment and reasonable priced drinks in turn makes for a good evening they do have like a kids club at times also have a small shop and a nice chip shop  then you have the top end of the side with a beautiful lake with many geese and ducks also does offer fishing at an extra cost the only thing I would say the place needs is some dog poo bins as a there was many dogs around including my own  but if I'm to be totally honest never saw any dog mess left anywhere there are plenty of regular bins about so  no big deal on the weekend we were there they had a car boot sale onsite which was good for a little nose.
So to conclude to us it felt like a mini holiday rather than camping in a field and will definitely be back for more great family trips glad we came and didn't listen to some of the negative reviews honestly go make your own opinions
Thanks for having us see you again very soonðŸ‘ðŸ‘

showerReviews.reviewText: I stayed here recently for a couple of nights, this was within the six weeks holiday so was knew it was going to be fairly busy which it was. Unfortunately, the pool was closed due to covid but the showers, toilets and washing up station were open. 20p for a hot shower is reasonable enough, I see people complain about this which is crazy. The showers and toilets were clean-ish I noticed there wasn't a toilet brush and someone had left rather alot of mess after themselves which I had walked in on then went directly to the next cubicle which was cleaner.  I brought my own toilet paper but I think that was also 20p if you had forgot your own, you can it it from reception. A good quantity of cubicles for showers and toilets as well so there's no waiting to get in one to use it which was great. This camp site has its own washing up stations with hot water just remember to bring your own washing up liquid and scrubber. Cash on arrival there was no option for electronic payments. Â£30 a night which I think is the going rate for a campsite with amenities and a Â£10 deposit which you get back, then your given a number I just displayed this in my car. We were told our dog had to be on a lead at all times which I can see why so we ended up taking long walks on the beach to burn the dogs energy. The site it's self was still quite loud gone 11pm with kids and adults still having a nice time which for us was a bit difficult to go to sleep but appreciate it is the summer holidays. The water station in the field worked but the drainage underneath was blocked, and the hand sanitiser station was open with dead flies in - see pictures. The staff seemed friendly enough gave us directs to the beach which was about a 10 minute walk away. This was two minutes in the car but it will cost you Â£6 to park up in the beach car park. Beautiful views to be seen all round and some great little walks. The beach was lovely and clean and lots of space to relax for the day. As camp sites go this one was good just minor issues.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great option for a womens only gym in Newport. The equipment is new and modern, and the shower facilities are sleek and clean. If you're looking for a straight forward in and out session I would recommend, but there are a few things to be improved to make it a better all-round experience:

There are almost never any staff. I feel there should be at least one person constantly to monitor for emergencies and for help if needed, or just a friendly face to welcome you.

When you come in, there is a separate area before the gym itself which could be improved. There are always giant black bags full to the brim of rubbish, and are put right next to the seating area. There is a fridge for an optional free bottle of water, but is hardly ever stocked. I would also like to suggest better seats to replace the hard metal ones.

Once you go through, it's the opposite issue for rubbish,  where the only bin is on the main floor. You often see empty bottles and used tissues in the changing room. This does not affect the showers themselves as they are always maintained well.

On the main floor, the equipment itself is clean, but as someone wary of germs, I would kindly recommend more antibacterial spray for members to wipe down before and after using the machines. My past few visits the bottle was empty.

Overall this is a nice place to workout, with a good selection of classes if you are into that. I know this gym has been open for less than a year, so these are simply teething problems. If my suggestions are taken on board I believe it will blossom into the perfect gym!
showerReviews.author: Joanne

showerReviews.reviewText:
The Caerleon Roman Baths was one of the weaker CADW sites we have visited. It was interesting enough, but the information on the baths was weak and not presented well. They have a video playing over the bath to show water effects and people swimming (see my videos posted with the review). Looks okay, but could have been so much better with better effects, scaled more human like people, they were about 9 feet tall and had odd body shapes, etc. The wall board says men and women never bathed together and then you turn around and the image of 2 people swimming in the bath is a man and woman. Again, the info wasnâ€™t presented well. Also the staff werenâ€™t great. They were friendly enough but didnâ€™t seem to know much about it and didnâ€™t seem to want to actually talk to anyone.

There was an interesting cavern under the pools that was the old drain from the pools. There is water in it today, probably ground water seeping through. The main water for the baths came from 5 miles away, amazing the work they put into the baths.

The other thing that is super neat but not explained well is the heating for the hot room. It had a raised floor and they somehow used the hot air and smoke from a fire to funnel through under the floor and heat the room. Pretty amazing those Romans!
showerReviews.author: Marcus O'Reilly

showerReviews.reviewText:
Interesting to visit if you are close by, the Baths built by the Romans and used by them for more than 200 years.  Caerleon was one of 3 large Roman settlements in the U.K., the other two being Chester and York.

built around AD 75 as part of the legionary fortress of Isca Augusta, home to Legio II Augusta in south-east Wales. They were a large and sophisticated complex, including hot, warm and cold rooms, an open-air swimming pool, and exercise areas, serving both hygiene and social life for Roman soldiers.

The baths were used for over 200 years while the legion was stationed at Caerleon, reflecting the importance of Roman bathing culture even in a frontier province. After the legion left in the late 3rd century, the buildings gradually fell into ruin, though their remains were noted in medieval times.

showerReviews.reviewText: I don't know how this venue compares with its peers. As a first time visitor, I found it inadequate in every regard - layout, core facilities, decor. It seriously lacks investment and is poorly maintained. The steam room was tepid (a regular told me there is no point in complaining as nothing changes), there is no cold water - not even a cold shower, to cool off (fundamental & inexpensive). I was forced to visit the very grubby outside smoking area to cool off. There is no drinking water dispenser, insufficient toilets (despite having the space), insufficient towel hooks and no signage. The main issue though is inadequate core facilities - sauna, steam, jacuzzi given the number of punters. They have the space to add more, and at Â£20 a visit, they certainly have the funds. Punters travel long distances as it's the only one around. They deserve better. If it wasn't for our primeval need for sex, this place would have closed a long time ago. A big shout out to the punters who were warm and friendly!

Moto Leigh is a decent rest stop with a few notable highlights and areas needing improvement. One of its strong points is the cleanliness and organization of the restrooms, which were consistently well-maintained. This attention to hygiene certainly adds comfort to travelers.

However, visiting Moto Leigh during hot weather can be challenging as there are no cooling amenities available. The lack of air conditioning or fans makes it uncomfortable to rest, especially during peak summer days.

On the positive side, the location is convenient, and parking facilities are ample, making it an accessible choice for travelers. With some enhancements, particularly in climate control and dining options, Moto Leigh could become a top-tier rest stop.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The reception staff were really helpful and pleasant. There are no lifts. If you have trouble managing stairs, please ask for ground floor rooms. I stayed for 3 nights. Pleasant experience and definitely lovely customer service.

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed at Penhein Glamping over the 2025 Easter Break and it was a little slice of heaven in Wales!

The tents were GREAT, when the wood stove was alight it was warm, it was waterproof (and the Welsh weather tested it!) we had all we needed for cooking and keeping items cool. It you were not brave (or patient) enough for cooking on a flame you could use the cheats kitchen. Inside the Cheats Kitchen sits the pantry and you could spend a little fortune there on fresh produce that was really tasty!
The shower block was clean, warm and good showers.

We attended the Lambing Live and had the BEST experience with assisting a delivery - I am not suggesting this is a common event as you never can tell with Nature but Helen Hearn was informative and answered every question with gusto and positivity. Feeding the orphan lambs was great fun too!

I would go back to Penhein again and shout it from the rooftops - go if you want a little adventure!
